channel.title: Half-Life 2 disables A.I.
channel.description:
So today I decided to play Half-Life 2 again, but strangely, the game disables the A.I. (and I have A.I. Disabled in huge white letters in my screen) and I have another message sayin' "Node Graph Rebuild".
By the way I have Vista x64.
'The hell?

item.title: Half-Life 2 disables A.I.
item.dc:creator: Crunchy
item.description:
I had the node graph problem. I updated my graphics driver and restarted my computer and never had the problem again. I play in 64bit mode on Vista. No problems. I never had the AI problem.

item.description:
Yeah, its a problem with the 64bit version of the game. Just add -32bit to the launch options and it should be fine.

item.title: Half-Life 2 disables A.I.
item.dc:creator: popsUlfr
item.description:
Oh crap. I’ve that problem too and am using Win7 64bit. The game automatically runs in 64bit mode. Is there a way to use 32bit version instead?
I’ve no interest in pressing a button every time the A.I. gets stuck :\

EDIT: Oh Yeah! I got it! just add “-32bit” in the “Set launch options…” and you should get rid of this problem

item.title: Half-Life 2 disables A.I.
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
Jokerine:

I remember asking for information about this once and being flamed because, according to some jackasses, that only happens to pirated copies.

Mine is legit.

Jokerine:

Does this help?

Go into your hl2\cfg\ folder, and create a txt file, inside this text file, write the following lines.
ai_norebuildgraph “1”
ai_disable “0”

Save, then rename the text file to ai_fix.cfg, right click the file and set it to read only.
Next, open up valve.rc in notepad, you should see the following

// load the base configuration
//exec default.cfg
// Setup custom controller
exec joystick.cfg
// run a user script file if present
exec autoexec.cfg
//
// stuff command line statements
//
stuffcmds
// display the start-up level
startupmenu

under “exec autoexec.cfg”, add this line:
exec ai_fix.cfg

Save the file and you’re done!

Yeah I tried this one, and it did removed the “Node Graph Rebuild”, but not the AI problem.

Jokerine:

EDIT: And how about this?

Also, you can open the folder where you installed Half-Llife 2, go to hl2/cfg/ and look for "config.cfg”. There you should find this:

bind “F5” “jpeg”
bind “F6” “save quick”
bind “F9” “load quick”
bind “MWHEELDOWN” “invnext”
bind “MWHEELUP” “invprev”
bind “MOUSE1” “+attack”

Under “F9” write this: bind “F12” “ai_disable 0;ai_step;ai_resume”. You should have something like this then:

bind “F5” “jpeg”
bind “F6” “save quick”
bind “F9” “load quick”
bind “F12” “ai_disable 0;ai_step;ai_resume”
bind “MWHEELDOWN” “invnext”
bind “MWHEELUP” “invprev”
bind “MOUSE1” “+attack”

Start the game, and when the “AI Disabled” message appears, press F12 several times, until the message disappears.

Thanks I’ll try this one.
